title: Baratza Encore ESP: The Best Budget Espresso Grinder?
excerpt: In-depth review of the Baratza Encore ESP. Perfect espresso grind range, consistent performance, and excellent value. Here's everything you need to know.
content:
Introduction

The Baratza Encore ESP is a game-changer in the budget espresso grinder market. At $199, it offers espresso-specific burrs and grind range that were previously only available in much more expensive grinders.

Key Specifications

  • Burr Type: 40mm conical burrs (M2 espresso burrs)
  • Grind Range: 1-20 (optimized for espresso at 1-10)
  • Motor: DC motor, quiet operation
  • Hopper Capacity: 227g (8oz)
  • Step Size: Approximately 20 microns per step

What Makes It Special

Espresso-Optimized Burrs

Unlike the original Encore (designed for drip coffee), the ESP uses M2 burrs specifically designed for espresso. This means:

  • Finer grind capability without stalling
  • More consistent particle distribution
  • Better extraction at espresso range

Perfect Grind Range

Settings 1-10 cover the entire espresso spectrum:

  • 1-3: Very fine (light roasts, high-end machines)
  • 4-6: Medium espresso (most users' sweet spot)
  • 7-10: Coarser espresso (dark roasts, pressurized baskets)

Real-World Performance

With Gaggia Classic Pro

Our testing with a Gaggia Classic Pro and medium roast beans:

  • Optimal setting: 4-5
  • Dose: 18g
  • Brew time: 28-30 seconds
  • Taste: Balanced, sweet, minimal bitterness

With Breville Bambino Plus

  • Optimal setting: 3-4 (lower pressure needs finer grind)
  • Dose: 18g
  • Brew time: 25-28 seconds
  • Taste: Clean, bright, good crema

Pros & Cons

Pros

  • Excellent value at $199
  • Espresso-specific burr design
  • Consistent grind quality
  • Quiet operation
  • Baratza's legendary customer service
  • User-repairable with spare parts available
  • Stepless mod available for advanced users

Cons

  • Stepped adjustments (not stepless)
  • Slower than more expensive grinders
  • Some retention (0.5-1g)
  • Plastic body (though sturdy)
  • Not ideal for single-dosing workflows

Who Should Buy It?

The Encore ESP is perfect for:

  • Beginners: Affordable entry into quality espresso
  • Home users: Occasional to daily use (not commercial volume)
  • Budget-conscious buyers: Best performance per dollar
  • Gaggia/Breville owners: Pairs perfectly with entry-level machines

Who Should Skip It?

Consider higher-end options if you:

  • Need stepless adjustment for micro-dialing
  • Want faster grinding (high volume)
  • Prefer single-dose workflow
  • Have a very high-end machine (La Marzocco, etc.)

Alternatives to Consider

  • 1Zpresso JX-Pro ($159): Hand grinder, stepless, better for single-dosing
  • DF64 ($400): Stepless, flat burrs, single-dose focused
  • Niche Zero ($650): Premium single-doser, zero retention
  • Eureka Mignon (~$400): Stepless, quieter, faster

Final Verdict

The Baratza Encore ESP is the best budget espresso grinder on the market. It delivers consistent, high-quality grinds at a price point that makes quality espresso accessible to everyone.

If you're starting your espresso journey with a Gaggia Classic Pro or similar machine, the Encore ESP is the perfect companion.
